subtasks: Sit on the tractor seat
Grip the steering wheel to control direction
Adjust the plow depth manually
Oversee the plowing operation to ensure straight rows

tasks.task: Attaching the plow to the tractor
subtasks: Lower the plow onto the hitch of the tractor
Secure the plow to the tractor using bolts or pins
Check the attachment for stability before starting the tractor
Load hay bales or crops into the trailer bed
Secure the load with straps or nets
Balance the load to prevent uneven weight distribution
Monitor for uneven ground that may damage equipment
Check for any signs of equipment malfunctions
Manual seeding if necessary after plowing

tasks.task: Driving the tractor while attached to the equipment (e.g., plow, trailer)
subtasks: Monitor speed and grading of the road while driving
Adjust throttle and gear shifts for optimal performance
React to terrain changes without causing equipment damage
Unfasten securing straps or nets
Lift the bales or crops from the trailer bed
Stack or distribute the load as needed

tasks.task: Ensuring documented preservation and handover of the equipment
subtasks: Check maintenance records to ensure regular servicing
Inspect equipment for wear or damage before use
Schedule regular oil changes and filter replacements
Grease or lubricate moving parts as needed
Inspect tires for wear and adjust air pressure
Check forecasts to plan plowing instead of during rain
Adjust operations based on current conditions (e.g., drying soil after rain)

tasks.task: Dig out the front pan from the plow
subtasks: Identify the stuck pan part
Remove the plow from the tractor
Use a spade or shovel to dig out the soil and debris
Clean the pan and replace any damaged parts
Locate feed and water for the horses
Measure the appropriate amount of feed
Groom the horses to ensure cleanliness and prepare for work
Lead the horses to the field or stable

tasks.task: Driving the horses in a harness
subtasks: Secure the horse collar to the harness
Attach the harness to the plow or other farming equipment
Adjust the fit of the horse’s harness for safety
Mount the horse or lead them with reins
Guide the horse through the plowing process

tasks.task: Transport and organize the seed carts
subtasks: Collect seed carts from the field
Ensure each cart has the correct type of seeds
Distribute the seeds onto the plowed field evenly
Refill the seed carts as necessary during long days

tasks.task: Moving the sand (for mixing with seeds)
subtasks: Transport sand from the storage area to the mixing station
Pour sand into the seed carts evenly
Distribute sand on the plowed ground as directed

tasks.task: Extinguishing a grass or forest fire
subtasks: Assess the size and location of the fire
Retrieve fire extinguishing equipment (hose, bucket, etc.)
Attempt to contain the fire before it spreads
Communicate with neighbors or emergency services if necessary

tasks.task: Removing the plow from the tractor
subtasks: Detach the plow using the tractor’s hydraulic system
Position the plow on a flat surface for maintenance or storage
Identify the broken or damaged sections of the plow
Use tools to disassemble the plow for repair
Apply welds or patches as necessary
Reassemble the plow and test its function

tasks.task: Shifting gears on the tractor while in motion
subtasks: Observe traffic signs and road conditions
Smoothly change gears to transition between different paces
Ensure smooth operation when moving from plowing to straight driving

Check the attachment for stability before starting the tractor), this suggests regular checks to prevent issues, akin to a pre-operation inspection. Hence, this task reflects a general practice in machinery use, but its specific mention in the transcript is when the attachment is being secured.
